name: Blue and Gold Macaw (Ara ararauna) – Blue Sky
description:
Native to Central and South America, this neotropical parrot is one of the most colorful birds of the tropical forest. Their species features a full yellowed chest, contrasted by a gradient of greens to blues hue from the head to the back and extending through the wings' outer plumage.

They are known for living up to 35 years and mate for life. While this arauana is not considered an endangered species, in islands such as Trinidad and Tobago and some countries such as Paraguay, the population has been decimated to critical levels and reintroduction programs have been used to repopulate this amazing bird.

IUCN Red List of Threatened Species status: https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/22685539/131917270

As a means to support conservations efforts, 10% of the profits from the first sales of the fifteen pieces will go to Aviario Nacional project in Cartagena, Colombia. (http://aviarionacional.co)
